summary: This is an internal email chain from July 2020 regarding the transfer of digital evidence in the Epstein case. An FBI forensic examiner requests a storage drive to copy materials before traveling to see a family member in hospice, and a US Attorney's Office coordinator arranges to provide one.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The FBI examiner who needs a storage drive to copy case materials before traveling to Denver to visit a sister in hospice.

persons.name: (USANYS)
persons.context: The coordinator from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is arranging to provide a storage drive for the FBI examiner.

connections.person1: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Coordinating the transfer of digital evidence materials between FBI forensic examination and the US Attorney's Office.

events.title: Evidence Transfer Coordination
events.description: Email exchange arranging for a storage drive to be provided to an FBI forensic examiner to copy the last of the case materials before the examiner's travel.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Examiner's Travel to Denver
events.description: The FBI forensic examiner plans to travel to Denver to visit a sister who is in hospice care.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: An FBI forensic examiner was actively copying digital evidence in the Epstein case as of late July 2020.
The evidence volume was described as not large in total size but consisting of a high number of files, fitting on a thumb drive.
The transfer was coordinated with the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The document is subject to a protective order restricting disclosure of certain paragraphs.
The examiner's personal travel due to a family emergency prompted urgency in completing the evidence copy.
